FuncDef: The display startup ap-id command displays startup information about a specified AP.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an AP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view startup information about a specified AP on a master, run the display startup ap-id command. The information includes:
File name of the system software configured for the current startupFile name of the system software used for the current startupFile name of the system software configured for the next startupName of the configuration file used for the current startupName of the configuration file configured for the next startupName of the PAF file used for the current startup, which is default by defaultName of the PAF file configured for the next startup, which is default by defaultName of the patch file used for the current startupName of the patch file configured for the next startup
If an AP does not find the file name of the system software configured for the current startup during startup, the startup program automatically searches the system directory for .cc files and uses the first .cc file to start the system.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
